Culture

Culture

arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement regarded collectively

Ethics

Secrecy

We like to share as much as possible about an adventure, except for the details of how to find it and get in. Throwing that information around tends to eventually add difficulty to entering and less enjoyment while inside, because people bring attention and wear. There are basically two ways to learn about a entrance: find it yourself, or be enlightened by someone who trusts you. That seems to have worked pretty well so far, so long as

Take Only Pictures

We do this for the fun and adventure, not profit. I don't think many people set out exploring in search of loot, so most theft that results is probably simply of opportunity. Whatsoever, it's unacceptable. We don't want people stealing our stuff, so we don't steal theirs. If you still feel inclined to take what isn't yours, let me mention that robbery is much worse than trespassing should you be caught.

Leave Only Footprints Leave No Trace

The two phrases are seperated to emphasize that you don't need to take something from a site to degrade it. Some of the nefarious tomfoolery includes breaking and entering, vandalism, graffiti, municipal and bodily dumping, arsen, et cetera. You get the idea, just respect urban environments with the same respect as other natural environments like the forest.

Couth

Our ethics didn't feel complete without this one. Just don't be stupid, have some courtesy, and have some fun. Don't be a brick and lock up entrances or steal stories. Please don't add to the list of utterly retarded graffiti that we find a lot of (link). Leave the Gate as You Found It, and maybe fill up a bag or two with trash if you know there's some where you're going.

Politics

Autonomy

The security cameras don't actually have to be operational for the people to act like they are being watched. Look at alcohol and tobacco, some of the worst things for you and they're sold at the store. You could kill yourself so easily with those things, and yet no one wants them illegal. We could all jam forks in our eyeballs and that's not illegal. Yet, the counter arguement is that nobody is really trying to jam forks or jump off bridges for pleasure, and those aren't even really the same to compare. Maybe you shouldn't make an areguement for opening up public spaces because really it's all like drains and caves but still talk a little about the autonomy idea.

The Value of Trespass

Minnesota Statutes

609.6055 Trespass on Criical Public Service Facility

This protects quite a lot of facilites, it mainly applies to drains and bridges for us though. Note the differences between aboveground and underground misdemeanors. Above, you can legally leave when asked to, unless signs are posted or if they've already asked you to leave in the last six months. But below, it's automatically a misdemeanor even without postings. Also, employees of the facility can detain you (link to Ford kidnapping) with reasonable cause, and you can be arrested on probably cause of violation in the preceding four hours.

97A.315 Trespass

If you knowingly disregard a sign, a personally notification, or commit three misdmemeanors in one year, they turn gross.

97B.001 Trespass

You can retrieve a hunting dog without permission, and you must leave the gate how you found it.

Teapots Happen

Max has had quite the experience thus far with life and I highly recommend reading what he had written about it. Teapots Happen is his "synchronicity" blog about all the magical stuff that has happened since exploring his crawlspace. I find it very interesting.
